attributes.action: withdraw his Government's proposal to impose a £20,000 retirement tax
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Under the Government's latest tax raid Britain's workforce face being worked until we drop dead, like bees or ants, unless we can afford to pay a £20,000 tax to be levied on retirement.  Its purpose is ostensibly to fund social care, which not everyone will need and for which many have made their own provision.  We also demand that the Prime Minister, as former Chancellor of the Exchequer, justify witholding contributions from National Insurance into which we have paid throughout our working lives.
